sentence: Masco Corporation'sMAS adjusted earnings of 20 cents per share in the first quarter of 2015 lagged the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 21 cents by 4.8%.
However, adjusted earnings increased 43% year over year driven by improved revenues and strong margins, partially offset by unfavorable foreign currency.
Masco's net sales of $2.02 billion missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2.04 billion by about 1%.
Revenues, however, grew 3% year over year on strong sales growth in Cabinet, Decorative Architectural Products Other Specialty and Installation segments.
Organic revenues increased 7% year over year.
North American sales increased 5% year over year to $1.64 billion, driven by growing demand for repair and remodeling and new home construction products in an improving U.S. economy.
International sales, however, declined 8% (up 10% in local currency) to $377 million.
Adjusted operating profit was $181 million, up 15.3% from the prior-year quarter.
Adjusted operating margin increased 100 bps year over year to 9.8%, driven by increased operating leverage and solid cost controls.
Operating margin increased 130 bps in North America to 9.8%.
Operating margin however decreased 150 bps in international markets to 12.2%.
Cabinets and Related Products: Segment revenues were $249 million, up 5% year over year owing to stronger performance in home center and builder channels.
Operating loss of $2 million was 78% narrower than operating loss of $9 million in the prior-year quarter, driven by higher operating efficiencies.
Plumbing Products: The segment recorded revenues of $796 million, down 1% year over year, owing to unfavorable foreign exchange.
Organic revenues however increased 8%, driven by growth in the wholesale channels.
Adjusted operating margin of 14.1% declined 100 bps year over year owing to higher expenses related to advertising, marketing and trade show.

Installation and Other Services: Installation and Other Services segment revenues were $359 million, up 7% year over year, driven by consistent growth in new homes construction, commercial and distribution channels.
Adjusted operating profit of $8 million was far better than adjusted operating loss of $4 million in the prior-year quarter, driven by strong operating leverage and profit improvement initiatives.
Decorative Architectural Products: Decorative Architectural Products segment revenues of $451 million were up 2% year over year on the back of solid performance by Behr Pro.
New Behr Color Solution Center rollout at The Home Depot HD stores is expected to be completed by the last week of May.
Adjusted operating margin increased 120 bps to 18.4%, driven by continued share gains of builders' hardware.
Other Specialty Products: Other Specialty Products segment revenues were $163 million, up 7% year over year, driven by stronger wholesale/dealer channel in North America window business.
Organic revenues increased 10%.
Other stocks in the construction sector that are worth considering include Quanex Building Products Corp. NX , Owens Corning OC and Armstrong World Industries, Inc. AWI .
While Quanex Building Products sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Owens Corning and Armstrong World Industries hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
